{"step_by_step_thinking": "Etomidate is known for its minimal cardiovascular effects, but it does not have an antiemetic effect. Thiopentone is a barbiturate used for induction of anesthesia, but it also does not have an antiemetic effect. Ketamine is an NMDA receptor antagonist and it is known to cause nausea and vomiting, so it does not have an antiemetic effect. Propofol, on the other hand, is known to have antiemetic properties and is often used to prevent postoperative nausea and vomiting.", "answer_choice": "B. propofol"}
